document_data.name: Here's a Health to the Company
document_data.mainbody: '''''Here's a Health to the Company''''' was a song about lovers and companions parting that was performed and enjoyed in [[Faer√ªn]].The title of the song is unknown, but the lyrics are very closely derived from the real-world folk song "Here's a Health to the Company". The name of its real counterpart is used for convenience.
document_data.History:
[[File:Beckside song.jpg|thumb|300px|''Lunasa (right) and Merlin (left) performing for no particular audience.'']]
The song was performed as a duet by the [[bard]] [[Lunasa Eveningwood]] and her companion [[Merlin Fastfoot]] while they stayed at [[Beckside Castle]] in [[Cormyr]] one night during the late 15{{th}} century [[DR]]. They also sang ''[[The Crafty Maid's Policy]]'' and ''[[The Mermaid]]'' together.
document_data.Lyrics:
{{quote|''Kind friends and companions, come join me in rhyme,
come lift up your voices in chorus with mine.
Let us drink and be merry, all grief to refrain,
for we may and might never all meet here again.

Here's a health to the company and one to my lass,
let us drink and be merry all out of one glass.
Let us drink and be merry, all grief to refrain,
for we may and might never all meet here again.

Here's a health to the dear lass that I love so well,
her style and her beauty, sure none can excel.
There's a smile upon her countenance as she sits on my knee,
sure there's no one in this wide world as happy as we.

Here's a health to the company and one to my lass,
let us drink and be merry all out of one glass.
Let us drink and be merry, all grief to refrain,
for we may and might never all meet here again.

Our ship lies at harbor, she's ready to dock,
I hope she's safe landed without any shock.
If ever we should meet again by land or by sea,
I will always remember your kindness to me.

Here's a health to the company and one to my lass,
let us drink and be merry all out of one glass.
Let us drink and be merry, all grief to refrain,
for we may and might never all meet here again.'' |The lyrics, as sung by Lunasa and Merlin}}
